result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt #650678 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive to Polk and Pierce County.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Attorneys to calcuate number of days served.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Minot, ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Nicholas Von Davis   DF:  Joel Martin Bruflodt appeared from jail. Includes 15CF370 and 15CF478. Case called at 9:58 am. Court reviews file. Set for SEH on 15CF370. Parties review PSI. Parties have found no error. ADA Minser makes argument. Atty Davis makes argument. Defendant makes statement. Court orders: 
- Count #1 - 20 yrs total - 10 yrs i/c, 10 yrs e/s 
- Count #2 - 6 yrs total - 3 yrs i/c, 3 yrs e/s
- Count #3. 30 Days jail.
 Counts run concurrent to each other but Consecutive to Polk County and Pierce County cases. Credit for time served. State to get compute number of days. Not eligible for bootcamp or Substance Abuse Program. Def to return to prison. 15CF478 remains open. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Nicholas Von Davis, DF: Joel Martin Bruflodt #650678 appeared from jail.  JURY TRIAL - DAY - 1 for 15CF370 - Case called at 9:24 a.m. with the jury present.  Attorney and DE are present.  Oath of Jurors for Trial as to Qualifications given.  Voir Dire by the Court at 9:30 p.m.  Panel Member ID 468 struck for cause.  Voir Dire by ADA Minser at 10:13 a.m. Voir Dire by Attorney Davis at 10:26 a.m.  Peremptory strike at 10:28 a.m.  Oath of Jurors for Trial at 10:39 a.m.  Jury out and recess at 10:43 a.m.  Court called and jury in at 11:03 a.m.  Intructions to the jurors.  Opening statement by ADA Minser at 11:13 a.m.  No opening statement by Attorney Davis.  S/T of Sergeant Scott Bangert of the River Falls Police Department.  Direct by ADA Minser.  DE is identified by Sergeant Bangert.  Pl - Ex. 1, Pl - Ex. 2, Pl - Ex. 3, Pl - Ex. 4, Pl - Ex. 5, Pl - Ex. 6,  Pl - Ex. 7,  Pl - Ex. 8,  Pl - Ex. 8, Pl - Ex. 9, Pl - Ex. 10 (Published to the jury by Sergeant Bangert), Pl - Ex. 11, Pl - Ex. 12, Pl - Ex. 13A, Pl - Ex. 13B & Pl - Ex. 13C (Published to the jury by Sergeant Bangert), Pl - Ex. 14, Pl - Ex. 15, Pl - Ex. 16, Pl - Ex. 16, Pl - Ex. 17,  Pl - Ex. 18, Pl - Ex. 20, Pl - Ex. 21 & Pl - Ex. 22.  Ex's 1-22 O/R.  Ex's 2-22 published to the jury by ADA Minser.  Witness excused.  S/T of Investigater Ryan Miller of the River Falls Police Department. DIrect by ADA Minser.   Pl - Ex. 24, Pl - Ex. 25,  Pl - Ex. 25A,   Pl - Ex. 26 & Pl - Ex. 27   Pl - Ex. 24-27 O/R.  Cross by Attorney Davis. Re-direct by ADA Minser  Witness excused.  Jury out and recess at 12:03 p.m.  Case recalled and jury in at 12:57 p.m.  Continued testimoney of Inves Jury out and discussions outside the presence of the jury at 2:10 p.m.  Recess at 2:15 a.m.  Court recalled outside the presence of the jury at 2:30 p.m.  Jury in at 2:32 p.m.  Continued Direct by ADA Minser of Investigator Miller.  Cross by Attorney Davis.  DE - Ex. 50 O/R.  Witness excused.  Sergeant Scott Bangert recalled.  Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Attorney Davis.  Witness excused.  S/T of Kenneth B. Olson of the State Crime Lab in Madison Wisconsin.  Direct by ADA Minser.  Pl - Ex. 28 O/R.  Cross by Attorney Davis.  Attorneys continue questioning.  Witness excused and released from his subpeona.  Pl - Ex. 29 O/R.  Jury out at 3:43 p.m.  DE wants to testify.  Court reviews the DE's right to testifiy.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly will testify.  S/T of Joel Bruflodt.  Direct by Attorney Davis.  Cross by ADA Minser.  Witness is excused.  Jury out and discussions outside the presence of the jury at 4:15 p.m..  Court reviews the Jury Instructions and Verdict Forms with the attorneys.  Jury back in at 4:36 p.m.  Instructions to the Jury.  Closing statement by ADA Minser at 5:00 p.m.  Closing statement by Attorney Davis at 5:26 p.m.  Rebuttal by ADA Minser at 5:36 p.m. Oath to Bailiff at 5:45 p.m.  Jurors out and begin deliberations and discussions outside the presence of the jury.  Recess at 5:46 p.m.  Case recalled.  2 Jury questions.  Court reads the questions.  ADA Minser requests time to research.  Court reads aloud his answer.  No objections from the attorneys.  Recess at 6:55 p.m.  Jury in and case recalled at 7:49 p.m.  Jurors have a verdict. 


The jury, duly impaneled, as and for our verdict in the above captioned matter, find the Defendant, Joel Martin Bruflodt, guilty of Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine, Contrary to Sec. 961.41(1m)(e)3.  Wis. Stats. as charged in Count 1 of the information for 15CF370.   

The jury, duly impaneled as and for our verdict in the above captioned matter, find the Defendant, Joel Martin Bruflodt, guilty of Felony Bail Jumping in violation of 946.49(1)(b). Wis. Stats. as charged in Count 2 of the Information for 15CF370.  

The jury, duly impaneled as and for our verdict in the above captioned matter, find the Defendant, Joel Martin Bruflodt, guilty of Possession of Drug Paraphernalia contrary to 961.573(1), Wis. Stats., as charged in Count 3 of the Information for 15CF370.  

Court poles the juror.

ADA Minser asks the Court to accept the verdict.  The court accepts the verdicts and revokes bail and the DE is remanded into the custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.

Court orders a PSI for 15CF370.  Set 15CF478 for an internal review.  Court adjourned at 8:01 p.m. lw

Apprs: CO: SRN for EJL, Rpr: Deiss, Clk: Dux, ADA Minser, Def Atty Nicholas Davis, Defendant appears. Court reviews amended information and accepts. Ct 1 - Deliver; Ct 2 - BJ; Ct 3 - Possess para. Procedures are reviewed with the Attorney's.
